Mikhail,
can you please provide the steps to reproduce this problem.

This is the posting in the CDT news group.

> I'm using CDT 2.1 with Eclipse 3.0.1, under windows 2k/cygwin. I am trying
> to use the gdbserver option for remote debug, but when I try to start the
> debug session, I get the following error:
> 
> Launching(Error: An internal error occured during: "Launching".)
> java.lang.NullPointerException
> org.eclipse.cdt.utils.xcoff.AR.isARHeader(AR.java:124)
> Several more lines (that for some reason I can't copy out of eclipse)

> I can remote debug from the command line just fine, and I can local debug
> using eclipse without problems as well. I am lead to believe that this is a
> bug in CDT. Are there any upgrades or patches that might fix this?

I just asked the reporter for the complete stack trace.
*** Bug 86924 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I think this should be fixed for 2.1.1 branch.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Mikhail,
> can you please provide the steps to reproduce this problem.

This can be done by calling:

XCOFF32Parser.getBinary(null, path);

This is a valid call and will generate an NPE.

The simplest way to fix this is to make the AR.isARHeader() static
method tolerant of null.  And it should be.

Vlad seem to be busy with Discovery stuff, I'll look into it.

Fix commited to the head and branch.

Thanks.
